title: New Business Location
name: new-business-location
description: As a Cafe, Restaurant or Bar, I am looking for commercial space in the City of Melbourne where I can open a new venue or extend my existing venue. I would like to know where similar businesses along, with their seating capacity, are located plus the density of residents and office workers in comparison.

title: Spot Parking Problem
name: spot-parking-problem
description: A city planner or goverment may want to locate the potential areas or city blocks where parking availability is underweight against the employment numbers and residetial dwellings, and plan to tackle the problem by extending public transportation.

title: Pedestrian Traffic Analysis
name: pedestrian-traffic-analysis
description: As a business owner, I want to know how much pedestrian foot traffic occurs in a potential new business location. I would like to be able to compare pedestrian traffic through the day, week and month. I would like to see visualisations that can help in deciding where I can start my new venture

title: Parking Availability
name: parking-availability
description: As a business that requires parking being available to either you or your customers, this will give you a great introduction to how a local business was able to solve their parking problems.

title: Melbourne Bicycle Network Routes and Road Safety Part 1
name: bicyclenetworkroadsafety-part1
description: As a cyclist, I want a safe transport journey in the city of Melbourne. Which roads are safest to cycle on? As a council, we seek to invest in road safety initiatives which reduce the occurrences of accidents resulting in serious injuries of citizens using our road network. Where are accident hotspots for cyclists occurring?

title: Melbourne Bicycle Network Routes and Road Safety Part 2
name: usecase-bicyclenetworkroadsafety-part2
description: As a cyclist, I want a safe transport journey in the city of Melbourne. Which roads are safest to cycle on? As a council, we seek to invest in road safety initiatives which reduce the occurrences of accidents resulting in serious injuries of citizens using our road network. Where are accident hotspots for cyclists occurring?

title: Ideal Green Wall Locations
name: ideal-green-wall-location-identification
description: This use case is designed for a city planner or goverment agent that may want to locate the ideal places around the city of Melbourne to install green walls. It may be beneficial to students as it provides examples of working with spatial databases utilising pandas, geopandas, shapefiles, socrata and folium.
